dt-example.title: Column priority
dt-example.info:
Responsive will automatically hide columns from the right-hand-side of the table, moving in as the table gets smaller, but it can often be useful to use a custom ordering, giving priority to certain columns (for example an actions buttons column, or a column with important information).
Column visibility priority can be defined in Responsive using the `r-init columns.responsivePriority` initialisation option in the DataTables column options (`dt-init columns` or `dt-init columnDefs`). The priority given is a number with lower values representing a higher priority.
This example shows the _first name_ column being given top priority and then the _extn._ column. Resizing the table will cause the other columns to be removed before these two columns - with the _first name_ column finally taking priority.
The column priority can also be defined by a `data-priority` attribute on the column's header cell (for example `-tag <th data-priority="1">First name</th>`).
